page.title: 15Portswood & St. Deny's
page.content: This area is served by a number of small town parks such as Portswood recreation ground, Lawn Park, and Riverside Park near Cobden bridge. The latter was developed by reclaiming land by infilling with the Town's refuse. These parks provide extensive open grassland with facilities for football, cricket, pitch, and putting greens as well as childrens' playgrounds for the local children. Along the riverside there are private moorings for motor and sailing boats and also for a number of houseboats. There is a rowing club. Dotted around the area are some small industries involving metalworking, scrap metal processing and warehousing and service industries. The Council developed Belgrave Rd. to accommodate small industries.
